    @allure.title("Test Cleaning agent SAL")
    @allure.description("This test case test the cleaning agent sal from list of equipment  when upper limit "
                        "for all criteria (toxicity,default ARL) criteria is selected "
                        "and sal unit is mg & default surface area is sqin")
    @allure.link("https://app.clickup.com/t/86ctwfbkp")
    @pytest.mark.cleaning_agent_sal
    @pytest.mark.validate_cleaning_agent_sal_upper_limit_mg_sqin
    def test_validate_cleaning_agent_sal_upper_limit_mg_sqin(self):
        upper_limit = Excel.read_excel_col_name_row_number(const.get_master_data(), "config",
                                                           "upper_limit", 2)
        policy_data = {"useToxicity": True, "useARL": True, "useResidueLimit": True, "residueLimit": upper_limit,
                       "salMassUnit": "mg", "residue_unit": "mg/sqin"}
        data = {}
        get_policy = json.loads(self.update_cleaning_agent.test_get_cleaning_agent_cleaning_limit_policy())
        get_policy = get_policy["policy"]
        update_policy = create_cleaning_limit_policy_cleaning_agent_payload(get_policy, policy_data)
        data.update({"update_policy_payload": update_policy})
        data.update(self.DEFAULT_SURFACE_AREA_SQIN)
        self.update_default_unit.test_update_default_unit(data)
        if get_policy != update_policy["data"]:
            self.update_cleaning_agent.test_update_cleaning_agent_policy(data)
            self.change_assessment.test_start_cleaning_assessment(scenario=True)
            self.change_assessment.test_submit_approve_cleaning_assessment()
    
        equipment_id = EQUIPMENT_ID
        for equipment in equipment_id:
            data.update({"equipment": equipment})
            sheet_name = equipment + "_cleaning_agent"
            columns = ["cleaning_agent", "upperlimit_mg_sqin"]
            manually_calculated_limit = self.calculated_sal_excel(sheet_name, columns)
            sal = self.get_equipment.get_cleaning_agent_sal(data)
>           compare_chemical(sal, manually_calculated_limit, columns, self.ERROR_MESSAGE)

    def compare(sal1, sal2, error_message):
        if sal1 != "#N/A" and sal2 != "#N/A":
            if sal1 < 1:
                length = (floor(log10(sal1)) - 1)
            else:
                length = 15 - len(str(int(sal1)))
            if length < 0:
                sal1 = (round(sal1, -length + 3))
                sal2 = (round(sal2, -length + 3))
                tolerance = calculate_tolerance(sal1)
                assert abs(sal1 - sal2) < tolerance, error_message + f" {sal1} Not Equal {sal2}"
            else:
                sal1 = round(sal1, 3)
                sal2 = round(sal2, 3)
                tolerance = calculate_tolerance(sal1)
                assert abs(sal1 - sal2) < tolerance, error_message + " " + str(sal1) + " Not Equal " + str(sal2)
